events.message: The customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred last night, causing significant front-end damage to their car.
The claim was categorized as an auto accident based on the description involving the car collision and damages.
An insurance agent has been assigned to handle the investigation and processing of the auto accident claim.
The claim has been officially acknowledged by the insurance company, and the customer has been informed.
The insurance company requested photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates from the customer.
Customer submitted all requested documents including pictures, the official police report, and detailed repair quotes.
The agent began reviewing all submitted documents and contacted witnesses to verify the circumstances of the collision.
The investigation concluded that the customer was not at fault and all damages were properly documented.
A settlement amount covering full repair costs and a rental vehicle during repair period was proposed to the customer.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and promptly accepted the offer.
Formal approval of the claim has been granted confirming the full coverage of repair costs and associated expenses.
The settlement payment was issued to the customer's account to cover the vehicle repairs and rental services.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that the customer received payment and repairs were completed.
All documents and correspondence related to this auto accident claim have been securely archived for future reference.
